description: From Middle English ariȝt, ariht, from Old English āriht (“aright, properly”), from earlier *an riht, on riht (“rightly”), corresponding to a- +‎ right.

entries.meaning: Rightly, correctly; in the right way or form.
(archaic) To or on the right-hand side.

description: From Middle English arighten, arihten (“to raise up”); and Middle English iriȝten, irihten, ȝerihten (“to make right, correct, erect”), from Old English ġerihtan (“to set right”), equivalent to a- +‎ right.

verbs.description: aright (third-person singular simple present arights, present participle arighting, simple past and past participle arighted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make right; put right; arrange or treat properly.
